column4: ok so I installed that restricted extras thing, but it wont let me use flash still on firefox?
Is flashplugin-installer actually installed? Not sure if it's a part of restricted-extras
If you are using Firefox, I recommend downloading the "FlashAid" addon. It helps with Flash problems on Firefox on Ubuntu :/
Such problems were always there, so.
Where are you searching for FlashAid? It's on addons.mozilla.org
Ah, seems it's a dead project now. Never mind.
Well, for starters pastebin the output of this: find / -iname '*libflashplayer.so*' -print 2>/dev/null
Do what? Open a terminal, type what I said in -- it's one line, by the way.
You're doing something wrong, "find" does not produce such output.
Just paste the command in, and you're supposed to enter it exactly like it appears
Seems Flash failed to install. You'll have to reinstall it: sudo apt-get --reinstall install flashplugin-installer
Well, that's already going somewhere. Just tell it to use the current version (Ubuntu isn't too up-to-date, especially if you're using an old version of it)
Uh, isn't there a "Load anyway" button?
Ugh. Okay, head over to the Adobe website, grab the .deb package from there (for Ubuntu) and use that.
http://get.adobe.com/flashplayer/otherversions/ - select your architecture (32 or 64-bit) and then "Flash player for Ubuntu (apt)"
